intro: Leandra viridiflava, commonly known as the green-flowered leandra, is a member of the Malvaceae family and is native to Central and South America. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in humid, tropical environments. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
